question: [File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Multiple Storage Services] If multiple storage services listen to the same notification channel (via cloned receivers), can race conditions in their refresh operations cause inconsistent views of committed state? (High)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Trait: Clone on StorageServiceNotifier] [Unbounded Cloning] Can an attacker create an unbounded number of StorageServiceNotifier clones, exhausting memory or causing the underlying channel to accumulate excessive sender references? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Clone Cost] Does cloning the notification_sender at line 85 have hidden costs (reference counting overhead, lock contention) that could be exploited in high-frequency notification scenarios? (Low)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Struct: StorageServiceNotifier] [Reference Counting] Does the channel use Arc internally, and can reference counting overflow or underflow be triggered by creating/dropping excessive notifier clones? (Low)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Pin Safety] Is the Pin usage in poll_next() at line 118 safe against Unpin violations, or can unsafe code elsewhere violate pinning guarantees and cause memory unsafety? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Poll Panics] Can poll_next() panic under any conditions (e.g., corrupted channel state), and if so, would this poison the entire state sync system? (High)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Trait: FusedStream] [Termination Invariant] After is_terminated() returns true, does poll_next() maintain the FusedStream contract of always returning Poll::Ready(None), or can it spuriously return Poll::Pending? (Low)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Context Waker] Can the Context waker be misused or cloned improperly, causing notifications to be delivered to the wrong task or lost entirely? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: fmt() for StorageServiceCommitNotification] [Information Disclosure] Does the Display implementation at lines 135-142 expose sensitive version information in logs that could aid an attacker in timing attacks or state inference? [File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: fmt() for StorageServiceCommitNotification] [Format String] Can the Display implementation cause panics or excessive memory allocation if highest_synced_version is a pathological value like u64::MAX? (Low)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Trait: StorageServiceNotificationSender] [Unauthorized Notification] Can components other than the state sync driver obtain a StorageServiceNotifier and send unauthorized notifications, causing the storage service to process fake version updates? (High)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Impersonation] Can a compromised component clone the notifier and impersonate the state sync driver, sending false commit notifications to manipulate storage service behavior? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Constant: STORAGE_SERVICE_NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_SIZE] [Burst Notification Loss] During a burst of rapid commits (e.g., 100 commits/second), how many notifications are effectively lost due to the size-1 LIFO channel, and can this cause unacceptable staleness in storage service data? (High)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Fire-and-Forget Semantics] Does notify_new_commit() guarantee at-least-once delivery semantics, or can network interruptions, process crashes, or channel errors cause notifications to be lost without retry? (High)

[File: state-sync/inter-component/storage-service-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Slow Consumer] If the storage service listener is slow to process notifications, can backpressure from the size-1 channel cause the state sync driver to block indefinitely, affecting consensus liveness?
